title: New Taric's stun hitbox is retarded
body:
Am I the only person that's noticed just how off taric's new stun hitbox is? It goes so much further than it says it will, and feels a lot wider too. Anybody else have this? 

EDIT: Not so much about how wide the hitbox is main problem seems to be length. Wideness is more based on character models IMO.

replies.body: If you have an opinion on this, please do post it here. I'm looking at his E hitbox, and I am interested in hearing people's opinions on it.

I think the main issue is the indicator does not have an "End of Range Line". Basically, his E's range is outlined by two lines to show it's width, but it never accurately shows where it ends.
Plus, while you can kind of see where the two width lines end on a still image, in-game it is harder to see since the lines somewhat fade a little near the end and it's much harder to see such smallish details in combat. People like being able to see a distinct "THIS IS THE AOE" indicator.
lines fading near the end you say? *looks at enemy jhin ult* thats not a problem anywhere else in the game is it?

When you first see the cast range of the stun, (as Taric) you'll see that there is a very small triangle at the end that still stuns. The problem is that the triangle is not shown to anyone but Taric when he hovers over his E.

This. I couldn't agree more with this. The main problem that I've come across is basically you think you're out of range but the end of it goes a lot further than is intuitive. Make it a more obvious particle effect like Jinx's Zap. The wideness aspect of it that I've noticed is probably just character models and not a problem with the skillshot itself.

I personally have not had any issues. I have a hard time hitting people with the very tip of its range indicator. Seems fine to me.

Someone else pointed out jhin's fantastically bad end-of-range indicator, but something else that always makes me go "wait wut" is Lux's ult hitbox. The way the spell is animated to be "above the ground" makes it really hard to see if it's going to hit you based on the parallax of your camera position relative to the ult. Something like lines-on-ground would do wonders along with the current animation.

I don't know about wideness, but it's length is certainly misleading. It's kinda the same thing that xerath's Q suffers from. it seems to extend beyond it's indicated max range.

I think either shortening it to fit its visual hitbox or just fixing the indicator would be good fixes.

I think it is just right.  Since it is a skillshot, being wide isn't necessarily a bad thing, especially with how short it is.  You have to be straight up in their face to use it.  Maybe you could give it the Xerath treatment where he slows down while casting it.  If you did that, though, I would suggest making it slightly longer.

Edit: Don't get too worked up and change a bunch.  People who complain are just those who aren't used to the new kit yet.
It's not the wideness that is the main issue, more just the length of it is very misleading. It goes further than you'd think based on the particle effect.

While not about Taric specifically, are you guys ever going to clean up indicators and particles to make them match the hitboxes? Obviously, width is hard/impossible to do because things would be wide to the point of looking silly. However, there is no reason that the hitbox of an ability should extend beyond the particle of the ability (or vice versa), and there is no reason that the particle of the ability should extend beyond the cast indicator.

The problem with 'cleaning up' particles that way is it often results in the opposite problem where you end up with abilities that look like they hit but actually didn't.  There is a real challenge between making particles that convey game effect properly and particles that look good because an particles with an abrupt end looks _terrible_ but tapering particles don't look like they cover the full hitbox.
